alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 11 at 1:08PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, 12 to 16 inches in the Pine Ridge area. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Dawes County and Northern Sioux County. In Wyoming, Converse County Lower Elevations and Niobrara County. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
